citation.article-title: The hierarchical system of the 'Alphaproteobacteria': description of Hyphomonadaceae fam. nov., Xanthobacteraceae fam. nov. and Erythrobacteraceae fam. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Erythrobacteraceae (E.ry.thro.bac.te.ra′ceae. N.L. masc. n. Erythrobacter type genus of the family; -aceae ending to denote a family; N.L. fem. pl. n. Erythrobacteraceae the Erythrobacter family).
Cells contain bacteriochlorophyll a and carotenoids.
Members of the family have been isolated from freshwater.
The family is a member of the ‘Alphaproteobacteria’.
The family comprises the type genus Erythrobacter Shiba and Simidu 1982 and the genera Erythromicrobium Yurkov et al. 1994 and Porphyrobacter Fuerst et al. 1993.
